name: TIME CELLS (2019)
description:
My practical work is a virtual space. Where one player can immersive themselves in a three-dimensional ground, surrounded by moving generative artworks. Time progresses to the speed of a play space, in accordance to the player’s movements. There is no clear objective, and little interactive involvement. It is designed to be a simulation, simply playing with time. Players can appreciate visuals or get lost in the play space. 

The project opens into future possibilities or branches I may want to research further into. It has potential for audio, to sync visuals or becoming interactive particles for touch screen devices.
